article.title: Duck_Hunt

template.arg: North American NES box art of ''Duck Hunt''.

article.paragraph: nihongo'''''Duck Hunt'''''ダックハントDakku Hantoyesis alight gun shootervideo gamedeveloped and published byNintendofor theNintendo Entertainment System(NES)video game console. First released in Japan on April 21, 1984, it was later released on October 18, 1985 in North America as alaunch gamefor the NES, and on August 15, 1987 in Europe. The game was released as aVirtual Consoletitle for theWii Uin 2014.

InDuck Hunt, players use theNES Zapperto shootducksthat appear on the television screen. The ducks appear one or two at a time, and the player is given three shots to shoot them down. The player receives points upon shooting each duck. If the player shoots the required number of ducks in a singlelevel (video gaming)round, the player will advance to the next round; otherwise, the player will receive agame over.

The game initially received few reviews, but was given mild critical praise and elicited a positive gamer reaction.Prior to the NES version, Nintendo also made aDuck Huntgame based onLaser Clay Shooting Systemreleased in 1976.Nintendo Duck Hunt (1976)The game would later be apack-in game, being a dual game pack with this game andSuper Mario Bros., and later a triple game with the same two games plusWorld Class Track Meet.
article.heading: Gameplay

template.arg: ''Duck Hunt'' offers different game modes, with two focused on shooting [[duck]]s (top) and the other focused on shooting [[Clay pigeon shooting|clay pigeons]] (bottom). In all modes, the player has three attempts to shoot the on-screen targets when they appear.

article.paragraph: Duck Huntis ashooter gamein which the objective is to shoot moving targets on the television screen in mid-flight. The game is played from aFirst-person (video games)first-personperspective and requires theNES Zapperlight gun, which the player aims and fires at the screen. EachLevel (video gaming)roundconsists of a total of ten targets to shoot. Depending on theGame mechanics#Game modesgame modethe player selects prior to beginning play, one or two targets will appear on the screen at any given time and the player has three shots, or attempts, to hit them before they disappear.cite web'Duck Hunt'http://www.nindb.net/game/duck-hunt.html2006-11-21[http://www.nindb.net/ NinDB]

The player is required to successfully shoot a minimum number of targets in order to advance to the next round; failure will result in agame over. TheBalance (game design)#Difficulty leveldifficultyincreases as the player advances to higher rounds; targets will move faster and the minimum number of targets to shoot will increase. The player receivesScore (game)pointsupon shooting a target and will also receive bonus points for shooting all ten targets in a single round.Duck Huntkeeps track of the players'Score (game)#High scorehighest scorefor all games played in a single session; it is lost, however, upon shutting the game off.

Duck Hunthas three different game modes to choose from. In "Game A" and "Game B", the targets are flyingducksin a woodland area, and in "Game C" the targets areClay pigeon shootingclay pigeonsthat are fired away from the player's perspective into the distance. In "Game A", one duck will appear on the screen at a time while in "Game B" two ducks will appear at a time."Game A" allows amultiplayersecond playerto control the movement of the flying ducks by using a normalNintendo Entertainment System#ControllersNES controller.cite webhttp://cheats.ign.com/ob2/068/007/007158.htmlDuck Hunt Cheats2006-11-21IGNThe gameplay starts at Round 1 and may continue up to Round 99. If the player completes Round 99, he or she will advance to Round 0, which is akill screen(in "Game A") where the game behaves erratically, such as targets that move haphazardly or don't appear at all, and eventually ends.cite webhttp://satoshimatrix.wordpress.com/2011/08/17/top-100-nesfamicom-games-list-100-90/Top 100 NES/Famicom Games List #100-90Retro and Contemporary Gaming Archives2011-08-17
article.heading: Vs. Duck Hunt
article.paragraph: Duck Huntwas also released as anarcade gamein theNintendo Vs. System''Nintendo Vs.'' seriesin 1984''Duck Hunt'' at Arcade Vault. Retrieved November 21, 2006.asVs. Duck Hunt, and is included in thePlayChoice-10arcade console.cite webhttp://www.gamersgraveyard.com/repository/nes/history/nes_arcade.htmlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20061210021100/http://www.gamersgraveyard.com/repository/nes/history/nes_arcade.html2006-12-10PlaychoicePlayChoice History2006-11-21The console supports two light guns, allowing two players at once.

Gameplay consists of alternating rounds of Games B and C, with 12 ducks/targets per round instead of 10 and sometimes requires the player to shoot three ducks/targets at a time instead of two. In addition, the player is given a limited number of lives; every duck/target that is not hit costs one life. When all lives are gone, the game ends.

After every second round, a bonus stage is played in which ducks can be shot for points as they fly out of the grass. However, thehunting dogoccasionally jumps out, putting himself in the line of fire and creating a distraction. If the player shoots the dog, the bonus stage immediately ends.
article.heading: Development and release
article.paragraph: File:NES-zapper.jpgthumbrightTheNES Zapperis required for playing ''Duck Hunt''.Duck Huntis based on a 1976 electronic toy version titledBeam Gun: Duck Hunt, part of theBeam Gunseries.cite webhttp://www.wired.com/gamelife/2007/02/video_1976_duck/Video: 1976 Duck HuntKohlerChris27 February 2007[[Wired (website)|Wired]][[Condé Nast]]23 January 2014The toy version was designed byGunpei YokoiandMasayuki Uemurafor Nintendo.Nintendo Research & Development 1developed bothDuck Huntfor the NES and theNES Zapper. The game was supervised by Takehiro Izushi,cite webhttp://www.n-sider.com/contentview.php?contentidPioneers of the Renaissance2006-12-11N-Siderand was produced by Gunpei Yokoi. Thevideo game musicmusicwas composed byHirokazu Tanaka, who did music for several other Nintendo games at the time.cite webhttp://www.hirokazutanaka.com/discography/http://www.webcitation.org/5z7fBwDs6DiscographySporadic VacuumTanaka, HirokazuJune 1, 2011June 1, 2011The game's music was represented in the classic games medley on theVideo Games Liveconcert tour.cite webhttp://www.videogameslive.com/index.php?storyThe Ground Breaking Video Games Live Hits UK Shores2006-12-12[[Video Games Live]]DesignerHiroji Kiyotakecreated thevideo game graphicsgraphicsand characters.cite webhttp://www.metroid-database.com/m1/fds-interview-p1.phpWe Were Drawing Pixel Art With A Famicom ControllerFamicom Disk System: The More You Play It, the More You'll Want to Play! [Disk 1]November 22, 2012Metroid Database

Duck Hunthas been placed in several combinationROM cartridges. In the Action Set configuration of the NES in the late 1980s,Duck Huntwas included withSuper Mario Bros..cite webhttp://www.consoleclassix.com/gameinfo_smdh_nes.htmlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20061207204513/http://www.consoleclassix.com/gameinfo_smdh_nes.html2006-12-07Super Mario Bros. and Duck Hunt2006-11-25[[Console Classix]]Super Mario Bros./Duck HuntThis particular cartridgeis found very often in the United States, due to it being included with the purchase of a NES.A Power Set was also available, which included the Action Set, thePower Padand a3-in-1 Super Mario Bros./Duck Hunt/World Class Track Meet3-in-1 cartridgethat includedDuck Hunt,World Class Track MeetandSuper Mario Bros.cite webhttp://www.amazon.com/SUPER-MARIO-BROS-TRACK-FIELD/dp/B000EYKS223 in 1 Cartridge2006-11-25[[amazon.com]]

Duck Huntwas re-released as a downloadedVirtual Consoletitle for theWii Uconsole in Japan on December 24, 2014, and internationally on December 25. This version is modified to require aWii Remotecontroller in place of the NES Zapper to aim and shoot targets on the screen.cite webhttp://www.gamespot.com/articles/nes-classic-duck-hunt-coming-to-wii-u/1100-6423395/NES Classic Duck Hunt Coming to Wii UJustin Haywald[[GameSpot]]November 5, 2014November 5, 2014cite webhttp://www.nintendoworldreport.com/news/39267/duck-hunt-coming-to-wii-u-virtual-console-on-christmas-dayDuck Hunt Coming to Wii U Virtual Console on Christmas DayOsborn, AlexDecember 19, 2014May 31, 2015Nintendo World Report
article.heading: Reception
article.paragraph: Video game reviews{{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web|url7.5/10 (Wii U)<ref nameAllgame called the game an "attractive but repetitive target shooter" and "utterly mindless... the game is fun for a short time, but gets old after a few rounds of play."cite webhttp://www.allgame.com/game.php?idDuck Hunt Overview2006-11-20[[Allgame]]Several user groups have rated the game positively.1UP.comusers gave it an 8.7 out of 10,cite webhttp://www.1up.com/games/nes/duck-hunt/Duck Hunt2006-11-201UP.comand theGameSpotcommunity gave theMario-Duck Hunt packagea 9.1 out of 10.cite webhttp://www.gamespot.com/supermarioduckhuntDuck Hunt2006-11-20GameSpotIt was rated the 150th best game made on a Nintendo System inNintendo Power's Top 200 Games list.Cite newsFebruary 2006NP Top 200[[Nintendo Power]]20058–66IGNalso placed the game at number 77 on its "Top 100 NES Games of All Time" feature.cite webhttp://www.ign.com/top-100-nes-games/77.htmlTop 100 NES Games of All Time2009-10-14IGNJeremy Parish ofUSgamerstated thatDuck Huntpaired with the NES Zapper "made the NES memorable" and was one of the key factors behind the success of the NES. Parish relatedDuck Huntto theWii Remoteof theWiiin that they made their respective consoles more approachable and reach a widerDemographic profiledemographic.cite webhttp://www.usgamer.net/articles/duck-hunt-the-template-for-wiiDuck Hunt, the Template for Wii's SuccessParishJeremyJanuary 22, 2014USgamerGamer Network
article.heading: Legacy
article.paragraph: File:Duck hunt nes dog.pngrightthumb''Duck Hunt'''shunting dogcharacter laughs whenever the player fails to shoot any ducks. The dog is both an infamous and iconic character in gaming.File:Duck Hunt, SSB4.pngrightthumbThe ''Duck Hunt'' "duo", as seen in ''Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U''.Duck Huntfeatures a namelessNon-player characternon-playablehunting dog(often referred to by the media as the "Duck Hunt Dog" or the "Laughing Dog") that accompanies the player in the "Game A" and "Game B" modes who provokes and retrieves the fallen ducks. The dog is infamous and iconic for laughing at the player whenever the player fails to shoot any of the ducks on screen. The dog has been labelled as "one of the most annoying video game characters ever" by numerous gaming critics and journalists, includingIGN,GamesRadar, andScrewAttack,cite webPirrelloPhilhttp://stars.ign.com/articles/883/883629p1.htmlACD: Duck Hunt Dog - Stars Feature at IGNStars.ign.com2008-06-232010-08-05cite webhttp://www.gamesradar.com/the-12-most-annoying-sidekicks-ever/The 12 most annoying sidekicks EVERGamesRadar2010-08-05cite webScrewattack's Top 10 douchebags in gamingscrewattack.comhttp://screwattack.com/videos/Top-10-Douchebags-in-Gaminghttp://web.archive.org/web/20100724170328/http://screwattack.com/videos/Top-10-Douchebags-in-Gaming2010-07-242011-08-16and many have expressed the desire to be able to shoot the dog.cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idVideo Game Bible, 1985-2002 - Google BooksBooks.google.com2004-01-162010-08-06cite webBuffa, Chrishttp://www.gamedaily.com/articles/galleries/characters-we-wish-we-could-kill-but-cant/?pagehttp://web.archive.org/web/20090507055503/http://www.gamedaily.com/articles/galleries/characters-we-wish-we-could-kill-but-cant/?page2009-05-07Gallery and ImagesGameDaily2009-05-042010-08-06Both IGN andNintendo Powerhave referred to the dog as something players "love to hate."cite webThomasLucas M.http://wii.ign.com/articles/825/825314p1.htmlSmash It Up! - The Animal Kingdom - Wii Feature at IGNWii.ign.com2007-10-052010-08-05cite book[[Nintendo Power]] 250th issue!2010[[Future US]][[South San Francisco, California]]50The dog's perceived "smugness" has helped him appear on several "best of" lists. In their lists for "Top 10 Video Game Dogs,"1UP.complaced the dog seventh, praising the dog's confidence for "laughing at a frustrated human with a loaded rifle,"cite webhttp://www.1up.com/features/top-10-video-game-dogsTop 10 Video Game Dogs from 1UP.com[[1UP.com]]2012-11-04Mackey, BobwhileGameSpyplaced the dog in tenth.cite webhttp://www.gamespy.com/articles/101/1019073p1.htmlNational Dog Day: The Top 10 Dogs in Gaming - Page 1GameSpy2010-08-06GameDaily andOfficial Nintendo Magazinehave included the dog in their "Greatest Video Game Moments" lists.cite webWorkman, Roberthttp://www.gamedaily.com/articles/galleries/top-25-nintendo-moments/?pagehttp://web.archive.org/web/20090131235806/http://www.gamedaily.com/articles/galleries/top-25-nintendo-moments/?page2009-01-31Gallery and ImagesGameDaily2008-12-122010-08-06cite webhttp://www.officialnintendomagazine.co.uk/14441/features50-greatest-nintendo-moments-10-1/Nintendo Feature: 50 Greatest Nintendo Moments: 10-1Official Nintendo Magazine2010-01-082010-08-06Brian Crecente ofKotakulisted him as one of his favorite video game dogs, stating that the dog's character design reminded him ofTex Averycartoons.cite webhttp://multiplayerblog.mtv.com/2008/03/07/and-the-award-for-greatest-video-game-canine-goes-to/And The Award For Greatest Video Game Canine Goes To...[[MTV|MTV Multiplayer]]March 7, 2008Video game developerMastiff (company)Mastiffreferenced the dog in promoting their video gameRemington Great American Bird Hunt, stating that Rockford, a dog in the game, will never laugh at players for missing the ducks.cite webhttp://www.kotaku.com.au/2009/11/mastiff-rights-the-wrongs-of-the-duck-hunt-dog/Mastiff Rights The Wrongs Of Duck Hunt DogKotaku.com2009-11-182012-11-04

UGO.comlisted the ability to kill the dog as one of the best video gameurban legends, stating that it is one of the few video game urban legends based in actual truth, since players could shoot the dog in the arcadeVs. Duck Hunt.cite webPlanteChrishttp://www.ugo.com/games/video-game-urban-legends-duck-huntKill the Dog in Duck HuntUGO.com2009-06-262010-08-06The dog makes a cameo appearance in the NES gameBarker Bill's Trick Shooting(another Zapper game) and he can be shot.cite webhttp://www.flyingomelette.com/cameos/cameosb.htmlVideo Game Cameos & References2006-11-21Video Game Cameos & References Database

InWii Play(2006) and its sequelWii Play: Motion(2011) some elements fromDuck HuntandHogan's Alley (video game)Hogan's Alleyare included in the mini-games "Shooting Range" and "Trigger Twist" in which some of the various targets are ducks and cans.

In the 2014fighting gamesSuper Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U''Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS'' and ''Wii U'', the dog and one of the ducks appear collectively as playable characters under the name "Duck Hunt (Duo)".Masahiro Sakurai, the games' director, stated thatDuck Hunt's commercial success as "the most-sold shooting game in the world" was one of the primary reasons for the characters' inclusion.cite webhttp://www.gamnesia.com/news/sakurai-explains-duck-hunts-inclusion-in-smashSakurai Explains Duck Hunt’s Inclusion in SmashJanuary 2, 2015February 2, 2015Gamnesia[[Game Revolution]]Rollins, StevenIn the games, Duck Hunt utilizes multiple attacks related to the NES Zapper, including throwing clay pigeons, kicking the can fromHogan's Alley, receiving assistance from the cast ofWild Gunman, or alerting the off-screen shooter to fire at opponents with the Zapper.cite webhttp://www.ign.com/articles/2014/09/11/new-super-smash-bros-characters-confirmed-in-streamNew Super Smash Bros. Characters Confirmed in StreamIGN16 October 2014cite webhttp://kotaku.com/people-are-starting-to-unlock-secret-smash-bros-charact-1633365911People Are Starting to Unlock Secret Smash Bros. Characters [Update]Kotaku16 October 2014The games also feature anUnlockable (gaming)unlockableDuck Hunt-themedLevel (video gaming)stage.

In the 2015Sony Pictures EntertainmentSonyfilmPixels (2015 film)Pixels, the dog made a cameo appearance as he is given as a "trophy" by the aliens when Sam Brenner (Adam Sandler) and Ludlow Lamonsoff (Josh Gad) defeat the creatures of the video gameCentipede (video game)Centipede. He stays in the house of an old woman inLondon.cite webhttp://www.businessinsider.com/nintendo-pixels-2015-7It's baffling that Nintendo let its treasured characters appear in Adam Sandler's new movieSmith, DaveJuly 23, 2015''Business Insider''
